text: The Roman Catholic Diocese of Zamość-Lubaczów () is a diocese located in southeastern Poland. It was established on March 25, 1992, and is a suffragan diocese in the ecclesiastical province of the Archdiocese of Przemyśl. == History == The Diocese of Zamość-Lubaczów was created on March 25, 1992, by Pope John Paul II. It was formed from parts of the Diocese of Lublin and the Diocese of Przemyśl. == Geography == The diocese covers an area of 8,144 square kilometers in southeastern Poland. It includes the cities of Zamość and Lubaczów, as well as the surrounding regions. == Demographics == As of 2021, the diocese has a population of 386,180 people, of which 98.7% are Catholics. There are 184 parishes within the diocese. == Leadership == The current bishop of the Diocese of Zamość-Lubaczów is Marian Rojek, who was appointed in 2012. The metropolitan archbishop is Adam Szal of the Archdiocese of Przemyśl. == Cathedrals == The diocese has two main churches: * The Cathedral of the Resurrection and St. Thomas the Apostle in Zamość, which serves as the principal church of the diocese. * The St. Stanislaus Church in Lubaczów, which serves as the co-cathedral. == References == == Other websites == * Official website of the Diocese of Zamość-Lubaczów Category:Catholic dioceses in Poland
title: Diocese of zamość-lubaczów
